Articles.Content:
I got an x-37b model for Christmas. Can\'t wait for this now

What scale? 1:1 ?

What scale? 1:1 ?

1:72 Still the biggest model I got. The other two were 1:400
Look at that reinforced carb... plastic?

Look at that reinforced carb... plastic?

Die cast steel. The x-37b is fricken heavy. its just barely balanced by the weighted base

This IS an X-37, though...

Sorry wrong spaceplane. (I thought the X-20 Dyna-Soar was the X-37)
Nova\'s far overestimating the amount of patience that we have. ;D
First post updated, 0.1 released!
ALL HELL BREAKS LOOSE

First post updated, 0.1 released!

Wait, where is the landing gear?! I can\'t land without my nosecone getting blown-up...

Wait, where is the landing gear?! I can\'t land without my nosecone getting blown-up...

No landing gear yet. I\'m waiting for animation. You don\'t need the nosecone once you land, anyway!

Hit a mountain, blew up all but the body and wings of the shuttle, continued going for a little bit in a different direction and ended up landing on another part of the mountain range.

This thing scared the heck out of Jebediah. I approve. Shame it didn\'t scare him for longer, though...
This thing is so light, it just won\'t stop!

Hah, managed to destroy it!

Took a bit of a powered nosedive at about 120 m/s, but I did it.

I strapped it to a 5 segment srb, sent it to 300km and then tried to land in the ocean. Very impressed how it recovered from a nose dive at a couple thousand meters. No RCS required. I gently bled speed and altitude and landed in the ocean losing only the engine block and nosecone. very successful!

I strapped it to a 5 segment srb, sent it to 300km and then tried to land in the ocean. Very impressed how it recovered from a nose dive at a couple thousand meters. No RCS required. I gently bled speed and altitude and landed in the ocean losing only the engine block and nosecone. very successful!

It\'s nigh-indestructible if you fire it into the water straight down. I hit the seafloor, once.
ill try that

Right..where to start. Nova...personally i think the way in which this craft handles should be the basis of every shuttle/glide entry type craft for when horizontal VAB is released as its perfect! Maybe it could do with a little more mass all over but other than that it handles brill. So far i\'ve managed to get into orbit and adjust orbit hights, detatch and 'dock' with my jetesoned stage (which without RCS i think is an achevement) I\'ve managed to land perfectly just by pulling up in the last 1000mtr to drop the velocity below 50mps and verticle hight to about 5mps. I\'ll admit i overshot the runway first time round but on only my second go i was way off to the right but managed to glide round 90degree\'s and land across the space center, even though i was a really far distance away. Honestly i hated the 'plane' mods on here and tried C7 once then deleted it, but this mod has changed my mind and will be giving C7 another go once i\'ve put this down. Only problem i have with it is the fragile nose cone, but i can live with that.
I\'m almost afraid to try making it heavier, so I don\'t break the flight mechanics.

I\'m almost afraid to try making it heavier, so I don\'t break the flight mechanics.

how about you make the fuel heavy so you have to empty it before landing

I\'m almost afraid to try making it heavier, so I don\'t break the flight mechanics.

Why not to make a backup file???

how about you make the fuel heavy so you have to empty it before landing

Hmm...I\'ve been flight testing it with a mostly full tank of fuel (in suborbital testing), but I think you might be onto something.
you know if you pklay with drags and make the stuff on top have .001 or so more drag it will automatically tilt the way you want in reentry
Thanks again Nova. :-*

1:72 Still the biggest model I got. The other two were 1:400

That\'s a JAXA H2A 202 rocket there in the bg!
